Respect Each Other.--We each have a work to do. We may be of different nationalities, but we are to be one in Christ. If we allow peculiarities of character and disposition to separate us here, how can we hope to live together in heaven? We are to cherish love and respect for one another. There is to be among us the unity for which 


                                                 427 

Christ prayed. We have been bought with a price, and we are to glorify God in our bodies and in our spirits.--MS 20, 1905.
